source: Loose Endymions<tab>Native to the seamlessly never-ending skies above the Northern Empty, Diadem endymions are a rare sight in the Sea of Clouds. When they do appear, however, it is to the sound of screams─screams of hapless victims being carried off to feed the cloudkin's hungry hatchlings.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
北洋の人拐い<tab>北洋から飛来した怪鳥が
空賊などを連れ去る事件が多発している
ディアデム・エンディミオンを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Bounty Hunter<tab>Its recent grounding at the hands of high winds is not the first time the infamous pirate vessel, the <var 1A 02 /var>Bounty<var 1A 01 /var>, has been stranded on a Diadem islet. Not but a few moons earlier, an attack by a winged monstrosity known amongst the Sea of Clouds' sky brigands as Hoita nearly tore the airship's hull in two.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
雲海の撃墜王「ホイタ」<tab>かつて漂流中の飛空艇バウンティ号を襲い
撃墜したという悪名高き怪鳥が姿を見せた
雲海の撃墜王、ホイタを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Bounty Hunter<tab>Its recent grounding at the hands of high winds is not the first time the infamous pirate vessel, the <var 1A 02 /var>Bounty<var 1A 01 /var>, has been stranded on a Diadem islet. Not but a few moons earlier, an attack by a winged monstrosity known amongst the Sea of Clouds' sky brigands as Hoita nearly tore the airship's hull in two.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
雲海の撃墜王「ホイタ」<tab>かつて漂流中の飛空艇バウンティ号を襲い
撃墜したという悪名高き怪鳥が姿を見せた
雲海の撃墜王、ホイタを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Lords of the Sting<tab>Wasp only in name, the jewel wasp is in fact a gargantuan jellyfish whose ancestors left the seas eons ago to hunt the skies. Little did they know they would be hunting the most dangerous game, and that game always hunts back.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ワスプストライク<tab>ディアデム諸島周辺空域にて飛空艇が
大型の浮きクラゲと衝突する事故が絶えない
墜落事故の原因、ジュエル・ワスプを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Cloudy with a Chance of...Thal's Balls<tab>A storm is coming...in the form of bloated sacks of gelatinous ooze known as cumulonimbi. It is difficult to believe that these alarmingly large sky jellyfish have achieved their staggering girth supping solely on small birds and lizards, recent reports of missing Lalafellin adventurers only fueling the flames of doubt.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
沸き立つ雲のように<tab>ディアデム諸島に棲息する浮きクラゲが
人を捕食することを覚え、急成長しつつある
人喰い積乱雲、キュムロニンバスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Mad Ventures in Retainer-sitting<tab>Not content with the paltry pickings his retainer was retrieving from ventures into the Black Shroud, a well-to-do noble recently ordered his humble hireling to the Diadem, forbidding the retainer's return until “treasure worthy of a king” was discovered. All the poor soul discovered, however, was a den of starving sky creatures, and now requires aid in escape.<tab><tab>Resolute retainer<tab><tab>
target:
無謀すぎた探索<tab>主のため、ディアデム諸島へ赴いたものの
危険生物に襲われているリテイナーがいる
生真面目なリテイナーを守れ<tab><tab>生真面目なリテイナー<tab><tab>

source: Where's the Beef<tab>A pair of adventurers tired of nibbling on stale tack and moldy cheese have followed their empty bellies to remote wisent grazing grounds, intent on bagging a stray bovine or three to roast over the night's bonfire. What they did not expect was one of the herd to (naturally) take offense.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
古の巨獣「フォゴットン・ウィセント」<tab>冒険者たちが巨大なウィセントを発見した
巨獣狩りに挑む冒険者たちに力を貸し
雲海の脅威、フォゴットン・ウィセントを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Excitable Boys<tab>Aether emitted by unstable elemental crystals is sending even the most docile of creatures into uncontrollable fits of madness. The condition appears to be irreversible, with a swift end the only means of granting these poor souls mercy.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
放属性シャードの悪影響<tab>放属性シャードが放つ属性の力により
周辺生物が興奮状態に陥ることがある
荒ぶるセルフィを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Sticking Celphies<tab>Some creatures have an eye for danger, while others simply have eyes that are dangerous. Celphies sit amongst the latter, their gaze deadly enough to stop the hearts of a thousand kings. Literally.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
魔眼の光<tab>戯れに魔眼の光を放ち
周辺生物の姿を変異させる獣がいる
はた迷惑な魔獣、セルフィを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Can You Smell the Blood Tonight<tab>Many summers following the murder of their father─king, nay, <var 1A 02 /var>emperor<var 1A 01 /var> of the Diadem─at the paws of their cruel uncle, a pride of cloud lions has returned from exile to reclaim their rightful throne. Unfortunately, their approach thus far has been limited to the indiscriminate slaughter of any and all other wildlife on their homeland isle.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
大帝か王か<tab>百獣の王、あるいは雲海の大帝と呼ばれる
獰猛な獣によって、多くの犠牲者が出ている
呼び名はともかく、クラウド・ライオンを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

target:

周辺生物が興奮状態に陥ることがある
荒ぶるルナンティシーを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Hail to the E<tab>There is something rotten in the air and it is literally leaving visitors to the Diadem with a not-so-fresh feeling. The culprit? A monstrous morbol known as Eccentric Eve. The solution? Her immediate slaying. Freshness has never been simpler.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
異臭の華族「エクセントリック・イヴ」<tab>数多くのバルブが芽吹いたことで
大型ルナンティシーが歓喜の異臭を放っている
異臭の華族、エクセントリック・イヴを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Lunantishee in the Sky<tab>Extreme levels of ambient aether can not only lead to the increased size and ferocity of a creature, but also to enhanced fertility. Case in point: the Diadem currently finds itself overrun with lunantishee seedlings who, if not dealt with swiftly, will grow into a veritable army of bloodsucking shrubbery.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
消臭力尽く<tab>環境エーテルが濃密になったことで
ルナンティシーが異常に繁殖しつつある
ルナンティシー・シードリングを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Whiplash<tab>Not many who encounter the dread seedkin Jidras' wicked tangle of whip-like vines survive to tell the tale, while those who have are forever changed. Forever scarred.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ムチとムチ<tab>ムチのようにしなる蔓により
数多の冒険者を滅多打ちにしてきた
拷問の達人、ジドラを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Blood Wings<tab>For centuries, the pegasi lived in relative peace amongst the forgotten isles of the Diadem. Humanity's recent return to the skies, however, has seen the majestic creatures once again made a target. A few defiant denizens such as the bejeweled pegasus are fighting back, but their indiscriminate rampages are now causing more harm than good.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
翼をさずける<tab>一角獣たちの嘆きを聞いたのか
膨大な魔力を持つ天馬が現れた
ディアデム・ペガサスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: NOT THE TREES<tab>Unnatural concentrations of ambient aether coupled with countless seasons of unobstructed sunlight can be attributed to the freakishly abnormal growth of the Diadem's bilokos─seedkin that if not laid low, will devour any living plant or animal within the reach of their probing roots and branches.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
根も葉もある噂<tab>濃いエーテルと潤沢な太陽光を受けて
樹状種族が急速に大型化を遂げている
急成長中と噂のビッグビロコを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Tightropen<tab>Pteranodons have long been hated amongst fishers, for they are known to greedily devour the selfsame wavekin those men and women depend upon for their livelihoods. Amongst the flying gluttons, there are some which are despised above all others─Ropen, whose mouths are so large, it is said they can scoop a hundred fish in a single dive.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ヌシを超える者「ローペン」<tab>幾多の漁師たちを泣かせてきた
大物のプテラノドンが飛来した
ヌシを超える者、ローペンを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: I'm the Scatman<tab>A sun-blotting flock of pteranodons is causing headaches for Ishgardian farmers in the most unexpected of manners. The feces of these prehistoric relics is highly corrosive, and can render a plot of land barren with just a single drop...let alone the hundreds that fall with a single flyby.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
営巣を阻止せよ<tab>有翼の古代獣、プテラノドンが集まり
新たな営巣地を造りだそうとしている
繁殖を防ぐため、プテラノドンを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Wild Hunt<tab>Known to hunt in pairs─one acting as a decoy, while another attacks from behind─the coelophysis of the Diadem have abandoned their old hunting grounds and taken to the skies above the adventurer campsites and airship landings so that they might stalk their newest delicacy─Lalafell.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ワイルドハント<tab>ペアで小動物を狩るコエロフィシスが
人を襲うために、大量に集結しつつある
群れを成す、コエロフィシスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: (You're) Killing My Mitelings<tab>A clutch of mite eggs has hatched and now a swarm of ageless mitelings is crawling about the isle consuming aught that moves. Squash the pests before they grow large enough to squash you.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: (You're) Having My Mitelings<tab>For the vilekin of the Diadem, every season is mating season, and so it is not rare to come across the cacophonous chittering and chirping that is an ageless mite orgy. A female mite can lay upwards of a thousand eggs in a single clutch, so it is left to brave adventurers to see the spawn never take seed.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ダイアマイト・ウェディングパーティー<tab>繁殖期を迎えたダイアマイトたちが
群れを成して、探索の妨害となっている
エイジレス・ダイアマイトとベーンマイトを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Nice Pirates<tab>A gods-fearing, mother-loving, goodly sky pirate has fallen from the rigging of his crew's airship. While fate deemed it not his time, and saw him land safely upon a tuft of crownbrush, fortune was not as impressed and made certain that tuft was located right in the middle of one of the Diadem's most deadly isles. Needless to say, the plucky picaroon might require some assistance.<tab><tab>Stranded sky pirate<tab><tab>
target:
ある空賊の受難<tab>ディアデム諸島に意図せず漂着した
空賊が周辺生物に襲われている
遭難した空賊を守れ<tab><tab>遭難した空賊<tab><tab>

source: (You're Not) Having My Mitelings<tab>Not all diremites are successful in finding a mate, leaving those which don't slightly more agitated than those which do. That agitation oft results in violent outbursts that can last several days until an islet is left a smoldering waste, or until the pent-up sexual tension is fully expelled.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

興奮収まらないダイアマイトが暴れている
猛るエイジレス・ダイアマイトを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

興奮収まらないダイアマイトが暴れている
猛るエイジレス・ダイアマイトを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Root of the Problem<tab>A scavenger, the Bariaua feeds solely on carrion, setting down its roots into corpses and draining them of their remaining humours. What makes this voracious seedkin different is that when hungry, it will not wait to come across a fallen creature, opting rather to slay its own prey in the most violent of fashions.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
死に花を咲かせよ<tab>屍肉に根を突き刺し養分をすする
妖花が新たな死体を作ろうとしている
大輪の妖花、バリアウアを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Good-bye Solo<tab>It is not known why Gerjis stalks his prey with a lone companion rather than bring the full strength of his pack to the hunt. What is known is that this practice has honed his skills as a predator, making the beast one of the most deadly sabertooth tigers in the whole Diadem.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
孤高の剣虎「ガージス」<tab>群れと別れ孤高を貫くサーベルタイガーが
新たな獲物を求めて、徘徊している
孤高の剣虎、ガージスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Purple Haze<tab>Purple worms spend nearly the entirety of their lives underground, rising to the surface only once or twice a twelvemoon to feed. It is during these brief forays into the sun that the creatures wreak the most havoc, devouring anything and everything they can before returning to the soil to slowly digest their victims.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
偏食の地底王「パープルウォーム」<tab>地中に潜む大型のウォームが
ギガントピテクスを食すために現れた
偏食の地底王、パープルウォームを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Excitable Boys<tab>Aether emitted by unstable elemental crystals is sending even the most docile of creatures into uncontrollable fits of madness. The condition appears to be irreversible, with a swift end the only means of granting these poor souls mercy.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
放属性シャードの悪影響<tab>放属性シャードが放つ属性の力により
周辺生物が興奮状態に陥ることがある
荒ぶるボーンフライを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Fly by Day<tab>More than half of airship accidents in the Diadem are attributed to hornflies─drawn to humming of the vessels' engines─becoming caught in propellers. Drive the vile creatures from the Sea of Clouds before further damage can be done.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
飛ぶ飛空艇を落とす勢い<tab>飛空艇のプロペラにボーンフライが
激突する危険な事故が相次いでいる
航行の安全のため、ボーンフライを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Forest for the Trees<tab>The return of the Missing Gem to the Diadem has resulted in further disruption of already erratic ambient aether levels. source: Hard of Heren<tab>Having lived for a thousand years encountering neither Lalafell nor Hyur, the Diadem's herensugues no longer fear mankind and his weapons of war. In their ignorance have they grown bold, leading to many attacks on newly arrived explorers to the islands. It is time they are reintroduced to the pain that kept their ancestors at bay.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

エレンスゲを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: The Other White Meat<tab>Until recently bottom feeders, many speckled hakulaqs have, of late, developed a taste for more exotic fare─more namely adventurous fishers braving the Diadem in search of their next catch. Volunteers are sought to help frighten off the hakulaqs that all might cast their lines in peace.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Mad Ventures in Retainer-sitting<tab>Not content with the paltry pickings his retainer was retrieving from ventures into the Black Shroud, a well-to-do noble recently ordered his humble hireling to the Diadem, forbidding the retainer's return until “treasure worthy of a king” was discovered. All the poor soul discovered, however, was a den of starving sky creatures, and now requires aid in escape.<tab><tab>Resolute retainer<tab><tab>

source: Westwhirled<tab>Named such for their tendencies to ride the Sea of Clouds' westerly winds, westerly sanuwas are an aggressive cousin to the common sanuwa, and are easily agitated by intruders into their domain. This includes airships, which oft use the westerlies to reduce ceruleum consumption on long voyages.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

航行中の飛空艇を襲う飛獣がいる

source: Am I Blue<tab>The Vundu are not ones to show kindness to the sanuwa they capture and tame, employing pain to force their mounts into ultimate submission. Some, however, resist this training and escape back to the skies, though not without their share of scars to the soul. Those known as the Deep Blue are one such example, their hatred of the foul men who laid hands upon them so great, that now they kill without discretion.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

不幸せの青い雲の如き、ディープブルーを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Who's for Dinner<tab>The serpent-like Uncegila are frighteningly methodical in how they prepare their prey for consumption, first crushing its bones to prevent escape, then delivering a powerful toxin which softens muscle tissue to a paste-like texture, but without killing the victim. The scalekin then devour the quivering mass feetfirst so that they might revel in their prey's final screams.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

source: On the Inside<tab>While much remains unknown about the charybterix, harrowing accounts of the colossal cloudkin using its scimitar-like claws to disembowel its victims have proven enough to convince House Haillenarte that a preemptive strike is the best interest of any and all who plan future forays into the Diadem.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

獲物の腹を引き裂き内臓だけを食す
美食の凶鳥、ガルピュデスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Blacker than the Foulest Witch<tab>Looking upon these frail creatures, one would not think that unicorns could contain much power. Yet when they are angered, that power oft translates into untold carnage and destruction. Woe betide the man who is fooled by their appearance, for bejeweled unicorns will not hesitate to drive their single majestic horns so deep into your gut, only a spell of temporal reconfiguration might remove them.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

一角獣が異様な興奮状態に陥るという
ディアデム・ユニコーンを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: How I Met Your Marid<tab>Marids are not known for being nocturnal creatures...yet one of the largest ever observed─Iriz Ima─prefers to feed under cover of night. Its eyes, however, are not suited for seeing in the dark, meaning these evening strolls oft end in the untimely flattening of countless animals, minerals, and Lalafells.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

夜な夜な徘徊し、暴れ回っている

source: Lunantishee in the Sky<tab>Extreme levels of ambient aether can not only lead to the increased size and ferocity of a creature, but also to enhanced fertility. Case in point: the Diadem currently finds itself overrun with lunantishee seedlings who, if not dealt with swiftly, will grow into a veritable army of bloodsucking shrubbery.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Pretty Flies<tab>Jewel flies earn their name from the bright, ruby-like color of their abdomens─a hue achieved by filling those translucent bellies with the blood of any creature luckless enough to cross the vilekin's path.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Freedom Flies<tab>Kinko is hotly pursued by several unsavory characters, and fears she will be unable to make it to safety on her own. If only some brave soul would see the roads safe once more.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

悪漢たちに追われている
紅洲の陰陽師を倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

target:

source: Showing the Recruits What For<tab>The Eorzean Alliance has no shortage of recruits willing to fight under its ivory standard. What it <var 1A 02 /var>does<var 1A 01 /var> have a shortage of is skilled fighters to assist in training the mewling privates. Adventurers are sought to bloody some noses.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ブートキャンプ：兵卒編<tab>エオルゼア同盟軍の演習に参加し
教導部隊の一員として敵役を務めよ
同盟軍の兵卒たちを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Showing the Officers What For<tab>It has been overlong since the Eorzean Alliance has taken part in any serious tactical engagements, and while peace is good for the realm, it dulls both swords and sword arms. Adventurers are sought to serve as the whetstones that will restore the army's edge.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ブートキャンプ：下士編<tab>エオルゼア同盟軍の演習に参加し
教導部隊の一員として敵役を務めよ
同盟軍の下士官たちを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Showing the Commanders What For<tab>Without competent commanders, the Eorzean Alliance would be naught more than an army of drunken farmhands and restless mercenaries, incapable of finding their way out of the South Shroud, let alone driving the Garlean invaders from Eorzea. However, to become a competent commander, one must first train against competent foes...or in other words─you.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
ブートキャンプ：士官編<tab>エオルゼア同盟軍の演習に参加し
教導部隊の一員として敵役を務めよ
同盟軍の将校たちを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Death Beckons<tab>Timmon Beck serves as the sole source of fresh water for many of the residents of East End...which is why the congregation of recently arrived sarcosuchus cannot be suffered to remain.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

ベロジナ・サルコスクスを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Unbearable<tab>Drawn from their dens by the ripe odor of the Eorzean Alliance's latrines, mountain grizzly sightings have become increasingly common as of late, some of these chance encounters leading to serious maiming or even death. The Allied armies seek adventurers to frighten the beasts back into the hills.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
熊と踊れ<tab>兵士たちの食事の匂いに誘われて
腹を空かせたグリズリーが集まってきた
マウンテン・グリズリーを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: The Secret Life of Plants<tab>Gyr Abania has its share of unique highland flora, from prickly thistles, to verdant worts, to <var 1A 02 /var>man-eating sapria<var 1A 01 /var>. It suffices to say the latter is not one of which the local smallfolk think that highly.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

食獣植物が繁茂している
サプリアを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Dizzy Miss Grizzly<tab>Flame scouts with the Eorzean Alliance are failing to return to their camps. The culprit, however, does not appear to be the Garleans, but a deadly grizzly sow that has acquired a taste for sweet Lalafellin flesh. As the scouts cannot afford to lose any more of their number, they seek adventurers to cleanse the hills in their stead.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

混交林の大熊、シャープアイ・グリズリーを倒せ<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Roid Rage<tab>Sightings of a gargantuan sarcosuchus colorfully dubbed the “Crocoroid” have residents of the Gyr Abanian Fringes guessing as to its origins, the most popular theory being it swelled to its unnatural size by consuming the discarded bottles of imperial performance-enhancing elixirs.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:

source: Bold This Way<tab>A pack of young-yet-bold gagana view the sheer cliffs surrounding Rhalgr's Reach as a prime location for their new nests. If allowed to roost on the rocks, it will not be long before the birds are raiding the town's livestock pens. Supplies are already scarce, so a quick solution to this potential problem is sought.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: The Morning After<tab>Swarms of skimmers─some of the vilest of all vilekin─have alighted in the Fringes to mate, and nothing works up an appetite like a frenzied fortnight of fornication. Unfortunately, skimmers have a taste for meat, preferably live, and will attack almost anything and everything that moves, be it livestock, pets, even something as large as a grown Roegadyn.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Thank You for Not Mossling<tab>While they appear harmless, mosslings are a threat to the fish that share the rivers in which they dwell. If left unchecked, a single colony of these swift-spawning, swift-growing seedkin can cover an entire lake in a matter of moons, blocking sunlight from reaching the riverbed, effectively killing the river's flora and the fauna that feed on it.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
target:
実はモス生まれ<tab>有望な漁場となる河川を

source: The Mail Must Get Through<tab>A storm herald carrying an important communication for his commanders is unable to cross the Velodyna, his way blocked by a school of goosefish. Part the waters and clear the poor man a path to freedom.<tab><tab>Storm herald<tab><tab>
target:

source: The Evil Seed<tab>Legend states that all diakka were born of seeds scattered by Kirnis in her wanderings across Gyr Abania. She continues her journey to this day, spawning more of the deadly seedkin while feeding herself upon the blood of unwary bystanders.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: The Spiderweb Chronicles<tab>The larger the spider, the larger the prey it must capture to sate its hunger...and Ankabut is one of the largest spiders to ever be reported in Eorzea. source: The Antlion's Share<tab>Ever seeking to expand their own dominion, aggressor antlions have begun encroaching on M tribe territory. If the trend is allowed to continue, it will not be long before young huntresses start disappearing.<tab><tab>M tribe ranger<tab><tab>

source: Really Don't Keratyrannos<tab>With their invasion, the Garleans brought with them myriad beasts of war and burden not native to Gyr Abania. source: Get Sharp<tab>As she does every day, a young maid of the M tribe has ventured into the wilds to gather sharp stones for her aunt, the village fletcher. source: The Tele-tale Hunt<tab>Ala Mhigan Resistance fighters have established supply caches across Gyr Abania in preparation for skirmishes with the Empire. source: Pop the Trunk<tab>The Vira keep marids not only for use in battle, but for their rich, fatty milk. The beasts, however, can be quite temperamental, and it is not rare that a beastmaid will lose track of one or two of her herd when grazing them in highland meadows. A good whack or seventeen is usually enough to calm their nerves.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Wet<tab>Her name meaning literally “wet woman,” Nure-onna is a malevolent spirit who has taken the form of a beautiful young maiden to lure men into her lair. Here, she flays her victims and feeds them to her pets─loyal gyuki demons who do her every bidding.<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Clean Bill of Health<tab>The hornbills that nest on the myriad islets of the Ruby Sea can prove a breathtaking sight from afar; however, up close, their rookeries are laden with foul-smelling bird lime that causes all manner of maladies when taken into the lungs. source: Quoth the Raven<tab>Ruby Sea alehouses are abuzz with tales of an ill-omened bird sailors have dubbed “Forevermore.” If the stories are to be believed, the cloudkin will alight upon a ship's prow and repeat the words “forever and ever” several times over before flying off to the horizon. The following morning, if even a third of the crew remains, they can consider themselves fortunate. Now, that bird is said to be frightfully near...<tab><tab><tab><tab>

source: Lay of the Lang<tab>A lone wolf is terrorizing the village of Isari, stealing livestock and defiling rice paddies. source: Pool Party<tab>A school of testy tatsunoko have congregated in the Blue Kojin's sunbathing pools and threaten to drive the peaceful beastmen from their daily basks. Drive the wavekin back into the seas whence they came so that the Blue might warm their shells once again.<tab><tab><tab><tab>
